page.title: 09WOODLANDS
page.content: Most of the land in our area was at one time owned by the Earl of Panmure, and, although many farmers have taken the opportunity to buy the land they farm, some farms are still tenanted, and some areas still managed by the Estate (now belonging to The Norwich Union Insurance Group). Most of the land managed by the Estate is woodland, grown for timber and also,in the Parks and Policies, for pheasant shooting. In our unit approx. 1 square km is under woodland grown for timber, consisting mainly of larch and spruce, with some Scots Pine. In the autumn gales of 1983, some 4 acres were blown down, and in each subsequent period of strong wind, more and more trees have succumbed. A decision was made to clear fell the area, and while most will be replanted, some of the better ground may be reclaimed for farming.
